title: Medical Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: It went so smooth, the director was so friendly, and the interview process thus far has been easy. I heard back from most positions I applied for within 1-2 days of applying.
Interview Questions: What my goals are. Where do I see myself in 2 years?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at OU Health (Tulsa, OK) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Group interview style with higher ups from the specific departments for the advertised position online. Asked true interview questions and not just selling you on the job. Have to be prepared with what you will say
Interview Questions: What’s your biggest professional achievement

title: Transplant Coordinator (RN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at OU Health in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Met with an interview committee. Talked for about an hour discussing position responsibilities, expectations, "a day in the life", and learning about me and whether I would be a good fit for that position.
Interview Questions: What makes you think you are a good fit for this position?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Casual and relaxed. Got to meet other staff members in a casual "get to know you" type setting, which was really nice. Then the more formal interview was still pretty casual. Eased my nerves tremendously.
Interview Questions: We have a lot of applicants, why should we pick you over the others?

title: BHT-behavioral Health Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at OU Health (Edmond, OK)
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly easy, just asked to tell stuff about myself, then the manager told me about the position and what to expect and then asked like 3 standard questions
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a disagreement with a coworker

title: Nurse Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at OU Health
Interview Descriptions: Simple, efficient. Was a very quick process. Only received one phone call interview which lasted five minutes, mostly discussed the details of the job. You have to park in the research park and take a shuttle during the week, but weekends you can park near the hospital.
Interview Questions: Do you have a BLS certification?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: There first was a 30 min phone screening with questions focused on what I was looking for and going over my resume. Then there was video conference interview with the same person who was in the first interview as well as someone higher up
Interview Questions:
What are you looking for in a job?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
What are your career goals?

title: Family Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at OU Health
Interview Descriptions:
HR set up interview. In person interview. Went smooth, interviewer is very friendly. 
No silly questions. Explained the job and expectations on what they were looking for.  Answered all questions I had. HR followed up after interview
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at OU Health
Interview Descriptions:
1. Phone pre-screen: If all goes well, then you proceed to step 2.
2. Interview with hiring manager: Van be virtual or in person. It usually depends in preference of manager.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you've received feedback from a manager. How did you handle the criticism?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at OU Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a fairly Hard interview. First with management and then with your peers.  Both times they go around a large table and each ask a different question. They were very friendly though
Interview Questions: What was a difficult problem at work and how you handled it

title: Cta Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at OU Health (Shawnee, OK) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter calls, then sets up interview then you do a background and drug test and start in about two weeks. It’s a fast process. And it took less than 4 hours to get a call back.
Interview Questions: They asked how much experience I had.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at OU Health
Interview Descriptions: It was quick and painless. Did a zoom interview and was offered a position the next day. The questions were all pretty generic but otherwise seemed applicable to my career and position.
Interview Questions: What was one difficult situation I was in and how did I handle it.

title: Health Unit Coordinator (HUC) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at OU Health
Interview Descriptions: Very chill. Mostly questions about how you've dealt with difficult co-workers in the past. Short interview over zoom and then an offer a week or so later. Ask whatever questions you have.
Interview Questions: How have you dealt with chaotic situations at work?

title: Coder II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at OU Health
Interview Descriptions: Not to difficult. Had to test for the coding part written in person.  4 people interviewed me at once. interview took about an hr. Very in depth conversation about expectations and the benefits offered.
Interview Questions: what are your specialties ?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at OU Health
Interview Descriptions: First was a call then 2 different panel interviews. The first call was with the manager of a specific area where you will be placed. Then you meet with the other managers, followed immediately with a panel interview.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions, they are pretty basic and then they dive into experience.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at OU Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a phone call to set up an interview date by a recruiter a few days after my application submission. I then went to my in-person interview (if in-state).
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation you were placed in and how you handled it

title: Health Unit Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at OU Health
Interview Descriptions: Very quick interview process. It was done over zoom due to the pandemic. Interesting questions were asked and it felt very comfortable. The whole interview lasted about thirty minutes including my follow up questions.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you were asked to do something outside of your job description?

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at OU Health
Interview Descriptions: Video interviews and contact with the recruiter. Very laid back atmosphere and they helped make sure that I was not overwhelmed throughout the interview. Consisted of 2 interviews, one with the unit manager and then a second peer interview.
Interview Questions: What is your five year plan?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at OU Health
Interview Descriptions: Office staff friendly, interview did not start on time but once I was called back, the interviewer got straight to the point, gave me a chance to go over my work experience and answered all my questions.
Interview Questions: What’s your previous work experience?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Multiple unorganized, meaningless interviews, inappropriate questions, position not as described,  very unorganized, unscripted, not informative, excessively long and drawn out, Interviewers were no on time or prepared. Questions that do not apply to position
Interview Questions: Views on diversity management style

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Group of interviewer ask questions , and they promise you what you like to hear to get you hired . After hired , they throw you wherever regardless of what they hired you for
Interview Questions: How do you react in stressful situation.

title: RN Float Pool Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from the recruiter and was very nice to me. She prescreened me and I got an inter view with the manager the following week and was hired in the spot with the manager when it was time to interview.
Interview Questions: I feel the questions were standard and straight to the point. I was asked about a wound assessment, what I would do in regards to HIPPA, future goals, and what I would contribute.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at OU Health
Interview Descriptions: I was so so excited for this interview. I prepared to no end, dressed the part, and was very positive and engaging. What I got in return was a series of basic nursing questions and scenarios. They didn't ask ONE question about me. Not one. Clearly, they were more interested in hiring robots instead of personable and passionate people. I didn't feel welcome at all, nor did I feel they wanted to give me the time of day. I was asked to do a peer interview, but declined.
Interview Questions: Suppose a man who comes from a certain culture forbids his wife from having a procedure because it goes against his culture, but the wife wants the procedure. What would you do?

title: Student Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at OU Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy. The interview was multiple leaders with different roles in the hospital. The longest part about the process was waiting for them to interview all of the candidates.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose OU?

title: Neonatal Intensive Care Unit RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at OU Health in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very rigorous and thorough. There are 3 interviews to secure the job. The questions were difficult, however the staff and interviewers were nice and tried their best to make you feel comfortable.
Interview Questions: If you were doing a wound care assessment and dressing change, what would you document in the computer?

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview is a half day process with shadowing to orient you to the floor, a peer interview, and a manager interview. The majority of the time was spent shadowing.
Interview Questions: How would you chart a dressing change?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK)
Interview Descriptions: The first interview is with the manager who asks a bunch of standardized interview questions and how would you handle these types of scenarios questions. The next interview is a peer interview with 2-3 of the staff nurses
Interview Questions: Tell us about a past mistake and what you did to correct it.

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied and shortly after I received a call and I completed two phone prescreen interviews and then completed a peer interview.  Shortly after my peer interview I received the job offer and started within two weeks from the offer. During my panel interview I got to speak with current team members and learn more about the department and team as whole which helped make my decision in joining OU Medicine.
Interview Questions: Asked about my background, experience, and my recruiting style.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK)
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews that were very long. Spent two hours interviewing with a tour of the laboratory in between.  Two people with each interview. Second interview is peer interview. One of the peer interviewers doesnt like to shake hands. Only shake hands if they offer. Interview questions were past situational questions. Thirty to fifty questions, but its easy. Didnt get the job because of lack of experience with PCR.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you struggled to meet a deadline

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews. The first interview lasted about two hours. Group interviews then main boss interview. The second interview was about how you would fit into one of the groups.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your working style?

title: PICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at OU Health
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by an HR recruiter to set up a time, I met with the PICU manager for about an hour and answered a series of scenario questions, then she arranged a shadow day for me that ended in a peer review (similar scenario questions).
Interview Questions: Tell us about one mistake you have made during your nursing career and how you managed it.

title: VP Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone/video interview then onsite with 10+ leaders and peers.  The time between the first interview and confirming the onsite interview was almost 2 months.  The onsite interview is a lot of people, but the people were all great.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at OU Health in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very laid back and informal. There were only a few questions and they mostly asked me to talk about my interests and why I had applied for this position. The office seemed organized and professional.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job?

title: Cardiovascular Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at OU Health
Interview Descriptions: Called in after submitting resume to director. Interviewed one on one. Senior staff member joined in latter part of interview peocess. Typical interview questions - team fit played significant role.
Interview Questions: Strengths/weaknesses

title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The manager was very friendly and easy to speak with. The recruiter was very friendly as well and overall a smooth process. The total interview was probably 45 minutes long.
Interview Questions: Past experience

title: Emergency Department Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK)
Interview Descriptions: Went into interview with current employees and Er Charge RN. They ask questions and kinda break the ice. They said that I smiled a lot and they needed to have someone in the department that was full of energy. I told them I'm willing to learn and I catch on quickly. I'm a people person who loves to help. I got a call the following week with a job offer.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work in Er department?

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone call to schedule an interview after applying online. Interviewed in person with both nurse managers on the unit for a little under and hour, then did a short peer interview. They called me 3 days after to offer me the job.
Interview Questions: Using your understanding of HIPAA, what can and can't you share, and with whom?

title: Informatics (Nurse) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Professional. Too many strange trick questions. Not as concerned with skills or that I was laid off and trying to get back in to keep my benefits. I don't know what happened to the days you could walk in off the street and get hired. Life was so much simpler then.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was peer interviewed by 3 employees.  They all had a rubric to follow and took turns asking me questions .  Peer interviews are alot less intimidating than management interviews.  We ended up laughing a few times.  It was very chill.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in 5 years?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, receive call for interview appointment, interview and hire, orientation and training. There really isn't 30 words for me to describe. Just keeping the description basic/simple for prospective applicants. Hope this helps.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time how you handled X situation.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel-peer interview process with 4 experienced nurses (no nurse managers or supervisors, only peers). Each nurse has a list of senario-based questions prepared. The peer nurses are the ones who ultimately decided on the hiring. The environment was very laid back, but it's always intimidating to have a group a experienced nurses testing you based on the knowledge of your responses. Overall, it was a great learning experience. The night before the interview, I googled "nurse peer interview questions" and wrote down my answers based on on-the-job experience (or clinical experience if you're a new grad). Although the question aren't exactly what you may be asked in your interview, it was very helpful, and I felt prepared.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: RN Trauma Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Process was painless. Just about everything is by email and confirmed that way. Very explanatory. Background history. Timeliness,  attendance., participating in meetings and staying involved. Flexible with scheduling
Interview Questions: How well you get along with others

title: Student Nurse Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was really simple.  There is a survey online that comes after you finish your application online.  The questions they ask in your interview is computer generated and picked depending on how you answered the survey online.  I interviewed with 3 different people in the same room.  One was another nurse technician working on the floor, the nurse manager, and the director of the unit.  They took turns asking the questions.
Interview Questions:
It was basic interview questions:

How to take a blood pressure

Normal blood pressure Levels

What are your short term and long term goals

Tell them about yourself

Some ethical/situational questions

How would you deal with a situation when you hear another nurse talk about their patient with another nurse on a different unit?

Difficult situation and how you resolved it

How you deal with stress

Weakness and strengths

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at OU Health in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The peer review interview is DEAD people....please move into the 21st Century. This is meaningless and a waste of time...many a good employee is lost because of the peer review .
Interview Questions: OU or OSU Fan?

title: Pharmacy Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at OU Health
Interview Descriptions: Took about 3 weeks. Applied online and 1 week later, I got an phone call about an interview. Then 1 week later  was offered the position
Interview Questions: What are you hoping to get out of this positon? Will you be satisfied enough to stay long-term

title: RN - Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Interview-
Signed into interview process in order of arrival. Hung out with the rest of candidates in the main room until interview. Called into room with manager and day time supervisor. Interview lasted about 10 minutes & was laid back. 

Peer interview-
Sat in from of a panel of 4 nurses. Asked behavioral questions and  questions about my resume. Nurses were fun and joked about the differences between units.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to think quickly

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at OU Health in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: One-on-one and peer reviews; had to interview with multiple people but they were courteous and professional with a recruiter spearheading the effort.  The peer interview was nice in that it wasn't a panel grilling type interview but more of a get to know you luncheon.
Interview Questions: how to you multitask

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at OU Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview with manager and supervisor then follow up with peer interview group.  Waited weeks to hear back.  Contacted by HR.  Then the background and drug testing and visit to employee help before orientation
Interview Questions: How to deal with difficult patients

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at OU Health (Edmond, OK) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, 1:1 interview, skills test, another phone interview with Dallas, group interview, background check, drug screen, job offer
Interview Questions: Why the medical field?
